meanings.definition: To time (an action) wrongly or inappropriately.
meanings.sent1: I always mistime my alarm clock and wake up late.
meanings.sent2: She tends to mistime her jokes and end up confusing people.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the actor would mistime his lines, creating unintentional humor.
meanings.sent4: The chef's attempt to mistime the cooking of the soufflé resulted in a deliciously fluffy dessert.
meanings.sent5: The gymnast's mistimed jump caused her to fall off the balance beam.

meanings.sent1: The mistime of the fireworks display disappointed the crowd.
meanings.sent2: He realized the mistime of his arrival when everyone had already left the party.
meanings.sent3: The mistime of the punchline made the joke fall flat.
meanings.sent4: The mistime of the music cue threw off the entire dance routine.
meanings.sent5: The mistime of the train schedule caused chaos at the station.
